intro: Dissolena verticillata, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a whorl at the base of the plant. Dissolena verticillata is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and compact growth habit.
